intro: Bonnetia bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahia bonnetia, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or yellow flowers and narrow, evergreen leaves. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in forested areas. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in botanical gardens and ecological studies.
